intro: Damnacanthus labordei, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters, and are attractive to pollinators. The plant contains toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation, making it important to handle with care.
